review_title: Great company to work for and great culture
pros: Great culture, work life balance and WFH flexibility
cons: Lots of red tape due to working with government, progression can be challenging as managers have been there for quite a while.

review_title: Flat structure and downfall of culture
pros: Long-standing friendly team brought on under prior leadership
cons: Lack of courage in senior leadership. Team speak up about grievances and you can feel the lack of support. No role progression due to extremely flat structure.

review_title: Work for a diverse range of industries
pros: Diversity of industries making a difference in R&D innovation
cons: Always a focus on accelerating innovation.

pros:
Absolutely loved my time at Hort. I was hired by a temping agency for a short term receptionist role. Was only meant to be there 4 weeks until they found a full
time hire but I insisted on extending for over three months. Loved the people, the office space, the culture. Everything! Sometimes receptionists are talked down to but they made me feel so welcome & like I was a part of their Hort family. Would go back in a heartbeat.
cons: North Sydney is a bit of a pain to get to but that’s it!

pros: Good culture and leadership, very supportive, flexible working
cons: Lots of politics, can be removed from actual farming practices and not the ones who do the work
